meanings.definition: A person who sells goods informally or at a market.
meanings.sent1: The higgler at the market had a variety of fruits and vegetables for sale.
meanings.sent2: I bought some handmade jewelry from the friendly higgler by the roadside.
meanings.sent3: The higgler jokingly offered to trade a banana for a diamond ring.
meanings.sent4: She was a higgler of stories, weaving tales that captivated her audience.
meanings.sent5: The higgler's colorful stall stood out among the other vendors.

meanings.definition: To haggle or bargain over prices.
meanings.sent1: Customers often higgle with street vendors to get a better deal.
meanings.sent2: I watched as the couple higgled over the price of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully higgled over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling market, voices higgled over the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The merchants and buyers higgled back and forth until they reached an agreement.

meanings.definition: To engage in petty or underhanded dealing.
meanings.sent1: Some people higgle to gain an unfair advantage in business.
meanings.sent2: He was known to higgle his way through tricky negotiations.
meanings.sent3: The kids higgled over who would get the biggest slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: She could see through his attempts to higgle his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The politician's opponents accused him of higgling to win votes.
